result.execSummary:
The defendant Patricia A Tucker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Domestic Violence Counseling or Anger Management and follow through as Agent deems appropriate.
No violent contact with the victim listed in the criminal complaint.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt:
Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Patricia A Tucker in court.  
Court Vacates Stayed Warrant.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2.
Counts 1 & 3 are dismissed as read ins.


Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation:  12 Months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
DV Counseling or Anger Management and follow through as agent deems appropriate.
Absolute sobriety.
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No Violent Contact with:  Victim listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Costs:  $243
DV Surcharge: $100
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Patricia A Tucker not in court.  
Case scheduled for 2 pm. and Matter called @ 2:38 pm.

Court orders a stayed warrant to the next court date.
MANDATORY APPEARANCE BY THE DEFENDANT IS REQUIRED.  Hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant is not to have any violent contact with David T.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Patricia A Tucker in court.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
